c74object.name: fl.perblock~
c74object.digest: Schedules one frame at the start of each host audio block.
c74object.description: The output is an empty trigger frame.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.perblock~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: process
method.description:
Process a non-realtime network,advancing time by the number of samples specified by the required length argument.
This will only take effect if the object has its rt attribute set to 0 More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

method.name: reset
method.description:
Resets a non-realtime network to the start of time ready for processing, optionally setting the sample rate. If the sample rate is omitted it will be set to the global sample rate.
This will only take effect if fl.perblock~ has its rt attribute set to 0. More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

method.name: signal
method.digest: Synchronise with audio or accept signal IO
method.description: Used to synchonise FrameLib objects with Max's audio processing.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: buffer
attribute.description:
Sets the non-realtime buffer~ for fl.perblock~. This is the buffer~ used for IO in a non-realtime setting.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.perblock~. When set to 0 fl.perblock~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.perblock~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
